result.execSummary:
The defendant Cheemoua A. Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination thereof.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO. AODA and any follow up recommended.  

DNA sample on each count.

timeConds.notes: with huber for work/treatment and/or EMP if defendant qualifies or is eligible under jail classification system.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant to be released from confinement no later than May 17, 2019 and any confinement time remaining upon his release shall be converted to extended supervision time.  

Any assessment/treatment/counseling.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Nikki;
Case called: 2:55 pm.

INCLUDES: 19CM1548, 19CM1549, 19CF846, and 15CF592.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears in custody w/Atty Emma Lawton.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

19CM1548:
Ct 1 (Operating While Revoked (rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)) >> DRI.
COURT grants.


19CM1549:
Ct 1 (Operating While Revoked (rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)) >> DRI.
COURT grants.


19CF846:
Ct 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater) >> DRI.
PLEA to Ct 2 (Possession Firearm-Convicted of a Felony/Repeater) >> GUILTY.
PLEA to Ct 3 (Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd)/Repeater)) >> GUILTY.
Ct 4 (Operate Firearm w/ Controlled Substance/Repeater) >> DRI.
Ct 5 (Operating While Revoked (rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)/Repeater) >> DRI.
COURT grants.


15CF592:
Defendant revoked from ES;
Attys waive revocation hearing;
Parties have agreement;
COURT ORDERS: 1 year in custody.


COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;


19CF846:
COURT ORDERS on Ct 2 >> 3 years prison; 1 year IC, 2 years ES;
CONDITIONS of ES: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two; Maintain absolute sobriety; No bars, taverns, or liquor stores.

COURT ORDERS on Ct 3 >> 6 months MCJ; pay $1,870 inclusive fine; D/L revocation for 27 months; IID for 27 months; 6 points reduction from license; AODA assessment and follow through; DNA sample and surcharge.

Defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP.
All counts/charges are to run concurrent to any other sentence/revocation sentence.
COURT grants 93 days jail credit in both cases.

Adj: 3:18 pm
